title: Paris
data: Paris  is the capital and most populous city of France. Situated on the Seine River, in the north of the country, it is in the centre of the Île-de-France region, also known as the région parisienne, Paris Region. The City of Paris has an area of 105 km² (41 mi²) and a population of 2,241,346 (2014 estimate)[5] within its administrative borders essentially unchanged since 1860.

title: Sydney
data: Sydney /ˈsɪdni/[6] is the state capital of New South Wales and the most populous city in Australia and Oceania.[7] Located on Australia's east coast, the metropolis surrounds the world's largest natural harbour, and sprawls towards the Blue Mountains to the west.[8] Residents of Sydney are known as 'Sydneysiders'. Sydney is the second official seat and second official residence of the Governor-General of Australia.
